Week of January 19, 2015 <http://strataconf.com/ca> STRATA + HADOOP WORLD, FEBRUARY 17-20, SAN JOSE Join us February 17-20 in Booth 721 at Strata + Hadoop World in San Jose and receive a 20% discount off the lowest published price until Strata + Hadoop World sells out with discount code: Pivotal20. To register go to: strataconf.com/ca <http://www.strataconf.com/ca>
Featured events:
Tuesday, 2/19 @ 11:30 AM: Rock Star Data Science in 2015 In this session, our Data Scientists look back at their 2014 activity, latest research efforts, and overall market dynamics to predict 2015 trends. Rousing QA included: Any angle of Data Science is fair game!
Friday, 2/20 @ 8:45 AM, Grand Ballroom 220: Keynote Sundeep Madra, Head of Data Products at Pivotal talks about agile data, and how Pivotal has fused the industry's leading open cloud platform with an enterprise class suite of data products to facilitate the agility companies will need to thrive in the third platform world. REGISTER <http://strataconf.com/ca> EPISODE #11: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 21ST, "LOGGING - HOW HARD COULD IT BE?" <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us this week, Wednesday, January 94th for Episode #12 of our All Things Pivotal Podcast Series, "Logging - How Hard Could It Be?"
Simon talks about the importance of logs to an IT department, and what to do from a Pivotal Cloud Foundry perspective to handle application logging. SUBSCRIBE <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> GEMFIRE XD 1.4 NOW AVAILABLE FOR DOWNLOAD <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/products/gemfire-xd-1-4-released-and-available> The latest release of GemFire XD 1.4 is now available for download. Its biggest improvements include single hop inserts for 50% faster performance, and support for JSON document objects in SQL tables. This makes GemFire XD even better for write-intensive use cases, such as high-speed ingest. Also, now we can support use cases that need more schema flexibility to the otherwise well-defined relational structure of GemFire XD.
READ MORE... <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/products/gemfire-xd-1-4-released-and-available> GROOVY 2.4 AND GRAILS 3.0 TO BE LAST MAJOR RELEASES UNDER PIVOTAL SPONSORSHIP <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal/news-2/groovy-2-4-and-grails-3-0-to-be-last-major-releases-under-pivotal-sponsorship> Pivotal today announced that it will fund the next two major releases of the Groovy and Grails through March 31st, 2015, after which it will no longer directly fund development on these open source projects. This post explains the plan to hand control of these projects to the community and other frequently asked questions.
